intro: Ilex ferdinandi, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Its hardy nature makes it suitable for ornamental landscaping in warm climates. Ilex ferdinandi is also valued for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions and its resistance to pests and diseases.
